column12: PROCESS FOR REDUCTION OF THE COMMON MODE CURRENT FOR POWER LINE COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT
column13: It permits common mode currents to be reduced in communications equipment using the mains network as transmission medium, in order to adapt the emission values of common mode to standards on power line communications corresponding to each country. The reduction in emission levels in common mode of signals transmitted by power line communications equipment permits the transmitted signal to be optimised in a way that manages to satisfy the existing regulations without sacrificing either coverage or performance of the communications system. It is characterised by the use of a special common mode choke at the outlet from the communications system which minimises the inductance in differential mode.

column12: METHOD FOR REDUCING COMMON-MODE CURRENT FOR POWER GRID COMMUNICATION DEVICES
column13: The invention relates to a method for reducing common-mode current in communication devices that use the power grid as a transmission means, in order to adapt common-mode emission levels to comply with the regulations regarding power grid communications in each country. By reducing the common-mode emission levels of the signals transmitted by the communication devices over the power grid it is possible to optimise the transmitted signal so as to satisfy existing regulations without sacrificing the coverage or performance qualities of the communications system. The invention is characterised by the use of a special common-mode choke at the output of the communication device, which minimises the differential-mode inductance.

column12: Method and apparatus for determining the weight of molten metal in situ.
column13: A method for rapid and accurate weight determination of molten metal in a slag-containing bath by the addition to the molten bath of a known weight amount of a "trace" element (preferably of a type which is completely diluted in the molten metal,tothe practical exclusion oftheslag); awaiting the even dispersal of the trace element in the molten metal (aiding the speed of dispersal by promoting a boiling action, if necess- sary); taking a sample of the molten metal ; analyzing the sample to determine the weight percent of trace element in the molten metal (for example by spectrometric analysis); and determining the weight of the metal from the known values of weight of the trace element added and its weight percent in the molten metal after addition. An apparatus for measuring the weight of molten metal or of slag in a slag-containing bath is disclosed, comprising means for determining the weight of a trace element, means for determining the weight percentage(s) of said trace element in the metal and/or in the slag, means for processing the weight and the weight percentage determinations from the foregoing means to generate a signal indicative of the weight of the molten metal or of the slag.

column12: GENERIC SENSOR READING DEVICE BASED ON A VIBRATING STRING WITH USB PORT.
column13: The invention relates to a conditioning and control device for vibrating string multiplexers with a USB communication port. The device of the present invention comprises a micro controller, four operational amplifiers, a comparator, two discrete transistors, a reference, and a micro controller with an analog-to-digital converter and two counters, an oscillator and a second micro controller for USB communication. The device receives a signal from a vibrating string type sensor that may (or may not) include a thermistor when is connected to a USB port of a PC, to a portable computer or a Tablet for feeding the device and allowing the configuration and reading software to be executed. There is also provided the option of reading vibrating strings that are connected to a multiplexer, since it includes the digital lines for generating the control signals required by multiplexers.

column12: PROCEDIMIENTO CONTINUO Y SISTEMA ESPECIAL PARA LA OBTENCION DE CIANURO DE SODIO
column13: La presente invención se refiere a un procedimiento continuo y sistema especial para la obtención de cianuro de sodio de elevada pureza, el cual comprende los pasos de: hacer reaccionar una corriente de ácido cianhídrico preferentemente como subproducto del proceso de acrilinitrilo u otra fuente; con una solución acuosa de sosa caústica, caracterizado porque la reacción de neutralización se lleva a cabo en un sistema continuo especial de reacción-cristalización, en donde se inicia en la línea de alimentación al sistema y se termina dentro de éste; evaporización controlada del agua contenida en la reacción de neutralización y propiciada por la generación de calor de la reacción; precipitación controlada de cristalización a temperaturas comprendidas de 50-70 grados C; separación de los cristales formados mediante filtración y secado de los cristales de cianuro de sodio mediante una corrinete de aire caliente.

column12: Process for reduction of the common mode current for power line communications equipment
column13: It permits common mode currents to be reduced in communications equipment using the mains network as transmission medium, in order to adapt the emission values of common mode to standards on power line communications corresponding to each country. The reduction in emission levels in common mode of signals transmitted by power line communications equipment permits the transmitted signal to be optimised in a way that: manages to satisfy the existing regulations without sacrificing either coverage or performance of the communications system. It is characterised by the use of a special common mode choke at the outlet from the communications system which minimises the inductance in differential mode.

column12: método de comutação de pacotes em um meio de transmissão que compreende múltiplas estações, as quais são conectadas usando diferentes conexões
column13: "MéTODO DE COMUTAçãO DE PACOTES EM UM MEIO DE TRANSMISSãO QUE COMPREENDE MúLTIPLAS ESTAçõES, AS QUAIS SãO CONECTADAS USANDO DIFERENTES CONEXõES". A presente invenção refere-se a um método de comutação de pacotes em um meio de transmissão que compreende múltiplas estações, as quais são conectadas usando diferentes conexões, cujo método é caracterizado pelo estabelecimento de diferentes conexões (9, 10, 11 e 12) no meio de transmissão ou em um meio diferente, com diferentes características de comunicação em um único meio e por um processo de comutação de quadro associado às conexões. Graças a isso, é possível o envio de quadros de um conjunto de equipamentos (2), conectado a um meio de transmissão (1) para qualquer outro conjunto conectado àquele mesmo meio (4, 5, 6 e 7), muito embora não exista conexão direta entre os mesmos, com todo o processamento sendo realizado no nível 2 do modelo OSI.

column12: Method and apparatus for automatically securing non-volatile (NV) storage in an integrated circuit
column13: A method and apparatus for automatically securing non-volatile (NV) storage in an integrated circuit provides improved resistance to code copying and reverse-engineering attacks. External interfaces that provide read access to the NV storage are be disabled, for a predetermined time after a reset or other initialization signal is received. An internal lock state bit or key is checked as well as an external lock prevent indication. If the lock prevent indication is not received, or the internal lock state bit is already set, then the integrated circuit is operated under a locked condition, in which external access to the NV storage values is prevented. The lock prevent indication may be a signal provided during reset of the integrated circuit on a terminal that is used for another purpose after initialization of the integrated circuit.

column12: CHITOSAN EXTRACTION METHOD.
column13: The present invention is a method for obtaining chitosan free of strange particles and in different presentations. Some advantages of the method are the reduction in extraction costs, the purity of the material and the formation of different physical presentations of the product; in early steps the deproteinization-desacetylation of the raw material, which optionally results from crustaceous wastes, is generated in the same step. The deproteinization and desacetylation is generally performed in different steps, with the purpose to obtain proteins without degradation; however although the proteins of the inventive process have a partial degradation degree may be sold at a lower price, considering that the cost of the protein sell may be partially absorbed by saving time, number of washes and reactants generated upon performing the deproteinization and desacetylation in a single step. Finally, in the precipitation step the way of dosing chitosan to sodium hydroxide is variable and may d epend on the desired shape of the obtained chitosan bodies, these may be spherical: dosed by dripping; threads: dosed in a continuous manner, for example using a syringe.

column12: GENERIC SENSOR READING DEVICE BASED ON A VIBRATING STRING WITH USB PORT.
column13: The invention relates to a conditioning and control device for vibrating string multiplexers with a USB communication port. The device of the present invention comprises a micro controller, four operational amplifiers, a comparator, two discrete transistors, a reference, and a micro controller with an analog-to-digital converter and two counters, an oscillator and a second micro controller for USB communication. The device receives a signal from a vibrating string type sensor that may (or may not) include a thermistor when is connected to a USB port of a PC, to a portable computer or a Tablet for feeding the device and allowing the configuration and reading software to be executed. There is also provided the option of reading vibrating strings that are connected to a multiplexer, since it includes the digital lines for generating the control signals required by multiplexers.

column12: MEDIO DE CULTIVO PARA BRADYRHIZOBIUM JAPONICUM
column13: El producto se vincula con la biotecnología agrícola, específicamente con la aplicación de biofertilizantes como sustitutos de fertilizantes químicos. El objetivo de la patente consiste en el desarrollo de un medio de cultivo para la producción de inoculantes para soya a base de Bradyrhizobium japonicum cuyo componente activo fundamental es un extracto de semillas de soya en un rango de concentración de 5 a 10 g/L. El medio de cultivo garantízalas necesidades nutricionales del microorganismo generando títulos de 108-109 unidades formadoras de colonias por mililitro de medio, a la vez que induce la síntesis y excreción de numerosos factores de nodulación por poseer componentes activos naturales en su composición. La inoculación de la soya con fermentos obtenidos en el medio de cultivo se traduce en resultados superiores de nodulación, induciendo la formación de entre 20 y 50 nódulos por planta y sobre los rendimientos del cultivo, incrementándolos entre un 10 y un 20%.

column12: METHOD OF SWITCHING PACKETS IN A TRANSMISSION MEDIUM COMPRISING MULTIPLE STATIONS WHICH ARE CONNECTED USING DIFFERENT LINKS
column13: The invention relates to a method of switching packets in a transmission medium comprising multiple stations which are connected using different link s. The invention is characterised by the establishment of different links (9, 1 0, 11 and 12) in one or more media, whereby different communication characteristics exist in one medium, and by a link-associated frame-switchin g method. The invention can be used to transmit frames from one piece of equipment (2) that is connected to a transmission medium (1) to any other piece of equipment that is connected to said medium (4, 5, 6 and 7) even if there is no direct link therebetween, all of the aforementioned process bein g performed in level 2 of the OSI model.

column12: METHOD FOR REDUCING COMMON-MODE CURRENT FOR POWER GRID COMMUNICATION DEVICES
column13: The invention relates to a method for reducing common-mode current in communication devices that use the power grid as a transmission means, in order to adapt common-mode emission levels to comply with the regulations regarding power grid communications in each country. By reducing the common-mode emission levels of the signals transmitted by the communication devices over the power grid it is possible to optimise the transmitted signal so as to satisfy existing regulations without sacrificing the coverage or performance qualities of the communications system. The invention is characterised by the use of a special common-mode choke at the output of the communication device, which minimises the differential-mode inductance.

column12: PROCESS FOR REDUCING COMMON MODE CURRENT FOR POWER LINE COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To reduce the common-mode current for power line communications equipmen.

SOLUTION: It permits common mode currents to be reduced in communications equipment using power lines as transmission medium, with the aim of bringing the common mode emission levels into line with regulations on power line communications corresponding to each country. Reduction in the common-mode emission levels of signals transmitted by power line communications equipment permits optimization of the transmitted signal, in such a way that the existing regulations are satisfied, without sacrificing either the coverage or the performance of the communications system. Here, the use of a special common-mode choke at the output from the communications equipment which minimizes the inductance in differential mode, at outputting from the communications equipment.

column12: Process for reduction of the common mode current for power line communications equipment
column13: A process for reducing common-mode current in a power-line communication equipment, where a power-line network is used as a communication medium, includes applying a signal transmitted by the power-line communication equipment via a common-mode choke circuit. The common-mode choke circuit includes braided signal cables mounted around a toroidal magnetic core. The signal is applied to the braided signal cables. The common-mode choke circuit is located adjacent to a connector of a power supply cable supplying power from a power outlet to the power-line communication equipment.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR PRODUCING BLISTER PACKAGE
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To save time and labor required for retooling in producing different kinds of blister packages on the same production line.

SOLUTION: An unprinted lid material 103 for blister packaging, which is wound round a roll 102, is supplied to a printer 101. The printer 101 performs printing on the lid material 103 according to a command from a host system 104. The printed lid material 103a is delivered to and processed in the post-processing of the blister package production line. In the case of the production of a different kind of blister packages, another data about printing is read into the host system 104.

column13: The method involves: recovering the distribution of the warp threads (1), weft threads (2) and nodes (3) where threads intersect; describing each thread-intersection node (3) in terms of a 3D position coordinate (x) and two movement coordinates, the warp movement coordinate (u) and the weft movement coordinate (v), which represent the movement of the warp threads (1) and weft threads (2); measuring the forces at each thread-intersection node (3) on the basis of a force model, the forces being measured both at the 3D position coordinate (x) and at the movement coordinates (u, v); and calculating the movement of each thread-intersection node (3) using derived movement equations which use Lagrange-Euler equations, and integrated digitally with the time, the movement equations representing the mass density distributed uniformly along the threads, as well as the forces measured and limit conditions.

column12: NUEVO METODO DE ANALISIS DE ELEMENTOS QUIMICOS, METALES Y NO METALES, EN LIQUIDOS POR ABLACION LASER PREVIA CONGELACION DE LA MUESTRA.
column13: Nuevo método de análisis de elementos químicos, metales y no metales, en líquidos por ablación láser previa congelación de la muestra. La presente invención se refiere a un método directo para la determinación cuantitativa de metales y otros elementos químicos para cualquier tipo de líquido mediante la técnica de ablación láser que posibilita la detección en concentraciones por debajo de los ppm (partes por millón) a algunos ppb (partes por billón). La invención se encuadra dentro del campo de la aplicación de la tecnología láser en la determinación de contaminantes en muestras líquidas de todo tipo como por ejemplo aguas pluviales subterráneas, afluentes naturales, cloacales, de residuos industriales, zumos de fruta, leche y sus derivados y de tipo biológico como sangre, suero, orina y otros. El método de análisis está basado en la congelación previa de la muestra y la subsiguiente ablación de su superficie, que se reivindica en la presente solicitud de patente presupone una importante innovación como así una mejora sensiblemente superior del proceso lo que permite una importante mejora en la sensibilidad, el manejo de muestras tóxicas o potencialmente peligrosas, útil para cualquier tipo de liquido susceptible de análisis in-situ, haciéndolo más directo y más simple y con excelentes límites de detección.

column12: método implementado por computador, sistema e produto de programa de computador para simular o comportamento de um tecido entrelaçado a nível de fio
column13: a presente invenção refere-se a um método que compreende: a recuperação da distribuição dos fios de urdidura (1), os fios de trama (2) e dos nós (3) de cruzamentos de fios; - a descrição de cada nó (3) de cruzamento de fios por uma coordenada (x) da posição 3d e duas coordenadas de deslizamento, a coordenada (u) de deslizamento de urdidura e a coordenada (v) de deslizamento de trama, que representam o deslizamento dos fios de urdidura (1) e de trama (2); -a medição das forças em cada nó (3) de cruzamento de fios com base em um modelo de força, em que as forças são medidas tanto na coordenada (x) da posição 3d quanto nas coordenadas (u, v) de deslizamento; - o cálculo do movimento de cada nó (3) de cruzamento de fios mediante o uso de equações de movimento derivadas que usam as equações de lagrange-euler, e integradas de forma numérica com o tempo, em que as equações de movimento representam a densidade de massa distribuída de maneira uniforme ao longo dos fios, assim como as forças medidas e as condições limite.
column15: DAVID MIRAUT ANDRES;;GABRIEL CIRIO;;JORGE LOPEZ MORENO;;MIGUEL ANGEL OTADUY TRISTAN

column12: CONSERVATIVE WHOLE BLOOD SAMPLE PREPARATION TECHNIQUE
column13: A method for the rapid preparation of a whole blood sample for photooptical analysis. A whole blood sample, lytic reagent system and stain are contacted in a reaction vessel with gentle, asymmetric vortex mixing. This method conserves the endogenous constituents of the sample, since the preparation of the sample occurs within a common vessel and any excess, unconsumed or unreacted, reagents and stain are not separated from the sample during preparation; thus avoiding the multiple wash steps traditionally employed. The lytic agent preferably is acidic and stromatolyzes the erythrocyte fraction of the whole blood, leaving the leukocyte sub-populations in an unlysed, near native state. The lysing can occur, before, simultaneous with, or after the staining in an elapsed time of 90 seconds or less.

column12: DISPOSITIVO DE FIJACION DE UN ELEMENTO DE DESGASTE O PROTECCION EN UNA PALA DE UNA MAQUINA DE MOVIMIENTO DE TIERRAS Y SISTEMA Y PROCEDIMIENTO DE FIJACION CORRESPONDIENTES
column13: Dispositivo de fijacion de un elemento de desgaste o proteccion en una pala de una maquina de movimiento de tierras y sistema y procedimiento de fijacion correspondientes. Dispositivo de fijacion de un elemento de desgaste o proteccion (1) en una pala (3) de una maquina de movimiento de tierras que comprende un tope, formado por un semitope inferior (7) y un semitope superior (9) unidos entre si mediante un tornillo (11), con una parte inferior (31) apta para alojarse en un alojamiento (17) dispuesto en una base (5) fijada a la pala (3). Ambos semitopes se pueden introducir separadamente en el alojamiento (17) a traves de una abertura (19) dispuesta en la cara superior (21) del elemento de desgaste (1). El conjunto formado por ambos semitopes tiene una vista en planta que sobrepasa el perimetro de la vista en planta de la abertura (19). El semitope superior (9) no esta en contacto con la pared anterior (29).

column12: Method of making polycarbonate
column13: A method of making a polycarbonate is described. The method comprises reacting an activated diaryl carbonate and a dihydroxy compound at a reaction temperature in a reactor to form a reaction mixture wherein the reactor comprises a heated cover and an open space between the cover and the reaction mixture. The dihydroxy compound comprises a vapor pressure greater than or equal to 0.01 kilo Pascals at the reaction temperature and the temperature of the open space in the reactor, the temperature of the cover, or the temperature of the open space and the cover is greater than or equal to the melt temperature of the monomer having the highest melt temperature.

column12: Computerized method, computer program product and system for simulating the behaviour of a woven textile interwoven at thread level
column13: The method involves: recovering the distribution of the warp threads (1), weft threads (2) and nodes (3) where threads intersect; describing each thread-intersection node (3) in terms of a 3D position coordinate (x) and two movement coordinates, the warp movement coordinate (u) and the weft movement coordinate (v), which represent the movement of the warp threads (1) and weft threads (2); measuring the forces at each thread-intersection node (3) on the basis of a force model, the forces being measured both at the 3D position coordinate (x) and at the movement coordinates (u, v); and calculating the movement of each thread-intersection node (3) using derived movement equations which use Lagrange-Euler equations, and integrated digitally with the time, the movement equations representing the mass density distributed uniformly along the threads, as well as the forces measured and limit conditions.

column12: COMPUTERIZED METHOD, COMPUTER PROGRAM PRODUCT AND SYSTEM FOR SIMULATING THE BEHAVIOR OF A WOVEN TEXTILE INTERWOVEN AT THREAD LEVEL
column13: Computer implemented method, system and computer program product for simulating the behavior of a woven fabric at yarn level. The method comprises: retrieving the layout of warp yarns (1), weft yarns (2) and yarn crossing nodes (3);describing each yarn crossing node (3) by a 3D position coordinate (x) and two sliding coordinates, warp sliding coordinate (u) and weft sliding coordinate (v) representing the sliding of warp (1) and weft (2) yarns;measuring forces on each yarn crossing node (3) based on a force model, the forces being measured on both the 3D position coordinate (x) and the sliding coordinates (u, y);calculating the movement of each yarn crossing node (3) using equations of motion derived using the Lagrange-Euler equations, and numerically integrated over time, wherein the equations of motion account for the mass density distributed uniformly along yarns, as well as the measured forces and boundary conditions.

column12: COMPOSITIONS AND METHODS FOR TREATMENT AND PREVENTION OF OSTEOARTHRITIS
column13: The present invention is in the fields of medicine, pharmaceuticals, neutraceuticals and rheumatology. In one aspect, the invention provides pharmaceutical compositions for the treatment and/or prevention of osteoarthritis in mammals, particularly humans, comprising sodium bicarbonate and calcium gluconate, and optionally comprising one or more additional components. The invention also provides methods of treating or preventing osteoarthritis by administering to a mammal, preferably via intraarticular injection, one or more compositions of the invention.

column12: Hydrogenation catalyst with improved textural properties
column13: A method is provided for making a catalyst support, and includes the steps of providing an aqueous suspension of refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide; forming the suspension into droplets; exposing the droplets to a gelling agent whereby the droplets are at least partially solidified so as to provide substantially sphere-shaped portions of refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide; and drying and calcining the sphere-shaped portions so as to provide substantially spherical particles of catalyst support containing refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide. Catalytically active metal phases and hydrogenation processes using the catalyst are also described.
column15: MARTINIS JORGE M;;VALERA MARIA E;;VELASQUEZ JOSE R;;CARRASQUEL ANGEL R

column12: FIXING DEVICE FOR FIXING A WEAR OR PROTECTION ELEMENT ON A SHOVEL OF AN EARTH MOVING MACHINE AND THE CORRESPONDING FIXING SYSTEM AND METHOD
column13: The invention relates to a fixing device for fixing a wear or protection element on a shovel of an earth moving machine and the corresponding fixing system and method. Fixing device for fixing a wear or protection element ( 1 ) on a shovel ( 3 ) of an earth moving machine that comprises a stop, which is formed by a lower half-stop ( 7 ) and an upper half-stop ( 9 ) attached to one another by means of a screw ( 11 ), with a lower portion ( 31 ) suitable for being housed in a housing ( 17 ) arranged on a base ( 5 ) fixed to the shovel ( 3 ). Both half-stops can be separately introduced in the housing ( 17 ) through an opening ( 19 ) arranged on the upper face ( 21 ) of the wear element ( 1 ). The assembly formed by both half-stops has a plan view exceeding the perimeter of the plan view of the opening ( 19 ). The upper half-stop ( 9 ) is not in contact with the front wall ( 29 ).

column12: Método de fabricación de policarbonato
column13: Un método de fabricación de un policarbonato, que comprende: hacer reaccionar monómeros que comprenden un diaril carbonato activado y un compuesto dihidroxi a una temperatura de reacción en un reactor para formar una mezcla de reacción; en donde el reactor comprende una tapa calefactora y un espacio abierto entre la tapa y la mezcla de reacción; en donde el compuesto dihidroxi comprende una presión de vapor superior o igual a 0,01 kPa a la temperatura de reacción; y en donde la temperatura del espacio abierto en el reactor es superior o igual a la temperatura de fusión del monómero que tiene la temperatura de fusión más elevada, y/o en donde la temperatura de la tapa es superior o igual a la temperatura de fusión del monómero que tiene la temperatura de fusión más elevada.

column12: 토목 기계의 삽 형상부에 마모 또는 보호 요소를 고정시키기 위한 고정 장치, 및 이에 대응되는 고정 시스템 및 고정 방법
column13: 토목 기계의 버킷에 있는 마모 또는 보호 요소를 위한 고정 장치, 및 이에 대응되는 고정 시스템 및 고정 방법이 제공된다. 토목 기계의 버킷(3)에 있는 마모 또는 보호 요소(1)를 위한 고정 장치는 하측 절반 정지부(7) 및 상측 절반 정지부(9)에 의해 형성되는 정지부를 포함하고, 상기 하측 절반 정지부(7) 및 상측 절반 정지부(9)는 나사(11)에 의하여 서로 결합되고, 버킷(3)에 체결된 베이스(5)에 배치된 하우징(17) 안에 수용되기에 적합한 하측부(31)를 구비한다. 상기 두 개의 절반 정지부들은 마모 요소(1)의 상측면(21)에 제공된 개구(19)를 통해서 하우징(17) 안으로 각각 도입될 수 있다. 상기 두 개의 절반 정지부들에 의해 형성되는 조립체는 개구(19)의 평면 형태의 경계를 초과하는 평면 형태를 갖는다. 상측 절반 정지부(9)는 전방벽(29)와 접촉하지 않는다.

column12: Verfahren und Vorrichtungen zum Erzeugen von Blasenverpackungen
column13: Eine Blasenverpackungsproduktionslinie umfaßt vorzugsweise einen nichtmarkierten Vorrat einer Rückenschicht zum Blasenverpacken, einen Drucker zum selektiven Drucken auf die Rückenschicht und ein Hostsystem, das den Drucker steuert und eine Vielzahl von gewünschten Entwürfen zu dem Drucker liefert. Der Entwurf, der auf die Rückenschicht gedruckt wird, kann nach Bedarf geändert werden, durch Übermitteln eines neuen Entwurfs von dem Hostsystem zu dem Drucker. Zusätzlich dazu kann eine Blasenverpackungsproduktionslinie einen nichtmarkierten Vorrat einer Materialrückenschicht zum Blasenverpacken, einen Drucker zum selektiven Drucken auf das Material und eine Formgebungsvorrichtung zum Bilden von Aussparungen in dem Material umfassen, die die Artikel aufnehmen, die blasengepackt werden. Der gedruckte Entwurf kann von einer gewünschten Länge sein.

column12: COMPUTER IMPLEMENTED METHOD,SYSTEM AND COMPUTER PROGRAM PRODUCT FOR SIMULATING THE BEHAVIOR OF A WOVEN FABRIC AT YARN LEVEL
column13: Computer implemented method, system and computer program product for simulating the behavior of a woven fabric at yarn level. The method comprises. retrieving the layout of warp yarns ( 1 ), weft yarns ( 2 ) and yarn crossing nodes ( 3 ):describing each yarn crossing node ( 3 ) by a 3D position coordinate (x) and two sliding coordinates, warp sliding coordinate (u) and weft sliding coordinate (v) representing the sliding of warp ( 1 ) and weft ( 2 ) yarns;measuring forces on each yarn crossing node ( 3 ) based on a force model, the forces being measured on both the 3D position coordinate (x) and the sliding coordinates (u, v);calculating the movement of each yarn crossing node ( 3 ) using equations of motion derived using the Lagrange-Euler equations, and numerically integrated over time, wherein the equations of motion account for the mass density distributed uniformly along yarns, as well as the measured forces and boundary conditions.
column15: CIRIO GABRIEL;;OTADUY TRISTAN MIGUEL ANGEL;;MIRAUT ANDRES DAVID;;LOPEZ MORENO JORGE

column12: Hydrogenation catalyst with improved textural properties
column13: A method is provided for making a catalyst support, and includes the steps of providing an aqueous suspension of refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide; forming the suspension into droplets; exposing the droplets to a gelling agent whereby the droplets are at least partially solidified so as to provide substantially sphere-shaped portions of refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide; and drying and calcining the sphere-shaped portions so as to provide substantially spherical particles of catalyst support containing refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide. Catalytically active metal phases and hydrogenation processes using the catalyst are also described.
column15: MARTINIS JORGE M;;VALERA MARIA E;;VELASQUEZ JOSE R;;CARRASQUEL ANGEL R

column12: COMPUTERIZED METHOD COMPUTER PROGRAM PRODUCT AND SYSTEM FOR SIMULATING THE BEHAVIOUR OF A WOVEN TEXTILE INTERWOVEN AT THREAD LEVEL
column13: - 경사(1), 위사(2) 및 원사 교차 노드(3)의 레이아웃을 검색하는 단계와; - 3D 위치 좌표(x)와 2개의 슬라이딩 좌표로 각 원사 교차 노드(3)를 묘사하는 단계와; - 힘 모델에 기초하여 각 원사 교차 노드(3) 상의 힘을 측정하는 단계와; - 라그랑주-오일러 (Lagrange-Euler) 방정식을 이용하여 유도되고 시간에 따라 수치 적분한 운동 방정식을 이용하여 각 원사 교차 노드(3)의 동작을 계산하는 단계를 포함하며, 상기 2개의 슬라이딩 좌표는 경사(1)와 위사(2)의 슬라이딩을 각각 나타내는 경사 슬라이딩 좌표(u) 및 위사 슬라이딩 좌표(v)이며, 상기 힘은 3D 위치 좌표(x)와 슬라이딩 좌표(u, v) 모두에서 측정되고, 상기 운동 방정식은 원사에 균일하게 분포하는 질량밀도, 측정된 힘 그리고 경계 조건을 처리하는, 원사 단위의 직물 거동을 시뮬레이션하는 컴퓨터 구현 방법, 시스템 및 컴퓨터 프로그램 제품을 제공한다.

column12: Methods and systems of producing blister packaging
column13: A blister packaging production line preferably includes an unmarked supply of backing for blister packaging, a printer for selectively printing on the backing and a host system controlling the printer and providing a variety of desired designs to the printer. The design being printed on the backing can be changed on-demand by transmitting a new design from the host system to the printer. Additionally, a blister packaging production line may include an unmarked supply of material backing for blister packaging, a printer for selectively printing on the material and a shaping device for forming recesses in the material that will receive items being blister packaged. The printed design can be of any desired length.

column12: método para fazer suporte de catalisador, suporte de catalisador, processo para hidrogenação de carga de monóxido de carbono
column13: MéTODO PARA FAZER SUPORTE DE CATALISADOR, SUPORTE DE CATALISADOR, PROCESSO PARA HIDROGENAçãO DE CARGA DE MONóXIDO DE CARBONO é provido um método para fazer um suporte de catalisador, e inclui as etapas de prover uma suspensão aquosa de óxido inorgânico refratário e carboneto inorgânico refratário; formar a suspensão em gotículas; expor as gotículas a um agente de gelificação pelo que as gotículas são pelo menos parcialmente solidificadas de modo a prover porções substancialmente no formato de esfera de óxido inorgânico refratário e carboneto inorgânico refratário; e secar e calcinar as porções no formato de esfera de modo a prover partículas substancialmente esféricas de suporte de catalisador contendo óxido inorgânico refratário e carboneto inorgânico refratário. Fases de metal cataliticamente ativas e processos de hidrogenação utilizando o catalisador também são descritos.

column12: Fixing device for fixing a wear or protection element on a shovel of an earth moving machine and the corresponding fixing system and method
column13: Fastening device for a wearing or protection element in the bucket of an earth moving machine and corresponding fastening system and procedure. Fastening device for a wearing or protection element (1) in the bucket (3) of an earth moving machine comprising a stop, formed by a lower half-stop (7) and an upper half-stop (9) that are coupled together by a screw (11) with a lower part (31) suitable for being housed in a housing (17) arranged on a base (5) fastened to the bucket (3). Both half-stops can be separately introduced into the housing (17) through an opening (19) provided on the top face (21) of the wearing element (1). The assembly formed by both half-stops has a plan view that exceeds the perimeter of the plan view of the opening (19). The top half-stop (9) is not in contact with the front wall (29) and wherein said through hole (23) extends between an upper face (43) and a lower face (45) of said upper half-stop (9) and defines a screw axis.

column12: Method of making polycarbonate
column13: A method of making a polycarbonate is described. The method comprises reacting an activated diaryl carbonate and a dihydroxy compound at a reaction temperature in a reactor to form a reaction mixture wherein the reactor comprises a heated cover and an open space between the cover and the reaction mixture. The dihydroxy compound comprises a vapor pressure greater than or equal to 0.01 kiloPascals at the reaction temperature and the temperature of the open space in the reactor, the temperature of the cover, or the temperature of the open space and the cover is greater than or equal to the melt temperature of the monomer having the highest melt temperature.

column12: Sistema de producción de etileno a partir de etanol
column13: La presente invención corresponde a un sistema de producción de etileno a partir de bioetanol que comprende una corriente de alimentación y una corriente de producto, y unas etapas de calentamiento, reacción, presurización, separación y purificación. column12: FASTENING DEVICE FOR ATTACHMENT OF WORN OR PROTECTIVE ELEMENT TO EXCAVATING MACHINE BUCKET AND CORRESPONDING FASTENING SYSTEM AND METHOD
column13: FIELD: machine building.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to a device for attachment of a worn element to a bucket of an excavating machine. Fixing device for attachment of worn or protective element to bucket of excavating machine, containing stop with lower part, made with possibility of arrangement in seat rigidly fixed to ladle base, at that stop is formed from lower and upper halves. In the set position, the lower and upper halves of the stop are fixed to each other by means of a screw located in the through hole of the upper half of the stop and the hole of the lower half of the stop. Lower half of the stop has a rear surface and a front surface, at least a portion of which is located on the lower part and faces the front wall of the seat, note here that lower half of thrust can be inserted into seat through opening in wear-resistant element top surface. Upper half of stop has front and rear surfaces and is made with possibility of vertical introduction through opening in upper surface of worn element. Assembly formed by the lower and upper halves of the stop in the installed position when seen from above is at least partially larger than the perimeter of the opening. At that, in the set position the upper half of the stop is not in contact with the front wall.EFFECT: reduced operating costs and increased efficiency.10 cl, 20 dwg

column12: BIOMIMETIC SYSTEM OF GRAVITATIONAL FILTRATION FOR COUPLING RAIN WATER CAPACITORS.
column13: The present device is able to filter rain water by passing said water by gravity through a plurality of modules that remove the suspended and pollutant solids with the quality required to use said water for services. The device uses different filtrating materials arranged inside the filtration modules, which are simultaneously connected by a plurality of industrial hoses of high resistance.

column12: HYDROGENATION CATALYST WITH IMPROVED TEXTURAL PROPERTIES
column13: A method is provided for making a catalyst support, and includes the steps of providing an aqueous suspension of refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide; forming the suspension into droplets; exposing the droplets to a gelling agent whereby the droplets are at least partially solidified so as to provide substantially sphere-shaped portions of refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide; and drying and calcining the sphere-shaped portions so as to provide substantially spherical particles of catalyst support containing refractory inorganic oxide and refractory inorganic carbide. Catalytically active metal phases and hydrogenation processes using the catalyst are also described.

column12: Methods and systems of producing blister packaging
column13: A blister packaging production line preferably includes an unmarked supply of backing for blister packaging, a printer for selectively printing on the backing and a host system controlling the printer and providing a variety of desired designs to the printer. The design being printed on the backing can be changed on-demand by transmitting a new design from the host system to the printer. Additionally, a blister packaging production line may include an unmarked supply of material backing for blister packaging, a printer for selectively printing on the material and a shaping device for forming recesses in the material that will receive items being blister packaged. The printed design can be of any desired length.

column12: Method implemented by computer, system and computer program product to simulate the behavior of an interwoven fabric at the thread level (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: Method implemented by computer, system and computer program product to simulate the behavior of an interwoven fabric at the thread level. The method includes: - recovering the distribution of the warp threads (1), the threads (2) of the weft and the knots (3) of the yarns crossing; - describe each knot (3) of yarn crossing by a coordinate (X) of 3d position and two sliding coordinates, the coordinate (u) of warp slip and the coordinate (V) of skid weft, which represent the slip of the warp (1) and weft (2) threads; - measuring the forces in each knot (3) of yarn crossing based on a force model, measuring the forces both in the coordinate (X) of 3d position and in the coordinates (u, v) of sliding; - calculate the movement of each knot (3) of yarn crossing using derived equations of motion using the lagrange-euler equations, and integrated numerically with time, in which the equations of motion represent the distributed mass density uniformly along the threads, as well as the measured forces and the boundary conditions. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column13: The present invention is in the fields of medicine, pharmaceuticals, neutraceuticals and rheumatology. In one aspect, the invention provides pharmaceutical compositions for the treatment and/or prevention of osteoarthritis in mammals, particularly humans, comprising sodium bicarbonate and calcium gluconate, and optionally comprising one or more additional components. The invention also provides methods of treating or preventing osteoarthritis by administering to a mammal, preferably via intraarticular injection, one or more compositions of the invention.

column12: COMPUTERIZED METHOD, COMPUTER PROGRAM PRODUCT AND SYSTEM FOR SIMULATING THE BEHAVIOUR OF A WOVEN TEXTILE INTERWOVEN AT THREAD LEVEL
column13: The method involves: recovering the distribution of the warp threads (1), weft threads (2) and nodes (3) where threads intersect; describing each thread-intersection node (3) in terms of a 3D position coordinate (x) and two movement coordinates, the warp movement coordinate (u) and the weft movement coordinate (v), which represent the movement of the warp threads (1) and weft threads (2); measuring the forces at each thread-intersection node (3) on the basis of a force model, the forces being measured both at the 3D position coordinate (x) and at the movement coordinates (u, v); and calculating the movement of each thread-intersection node (3) using derived movement equations which use Lagrange-Euler equations, and integrated digitally with the time, the movement equations representing the mass density distributed uniformly along the threads, as well as the forces measured and limit conditions.

column12: CONSERVATIVE WHOLE BLOOD SAMPLE PREPARATION TECHNIQUE.
column13: Procédé permettant de préparer rapidement un échantillon de sang entier en vue d'une analyse photo-optique. On met en contact un échantillon de sang entier, un système de réactif lytique ainsi qu'un colorant dans un récipient de réaction par mélange tourbillonnaire asymétrique doux. Ce procédé conserve les constituants endogènes de l'échantillon, puisque la préparation de l'échantillon a lieu dans un récipient commun, les éventuels réactifs et colorant excédentaires non consommés ou n'ayant pas réagi n'étant pas séparés de l'échantillon pendant la préparation, ce qui évite les multiples lavages traditionnellement effectués. L'agent lytique est de préférence acide et stromatolyse la fraction d'érythrocytes du sang entier, laissant les sous-populations de leukocytes dans un état non lysé presque natif. La lyse peut avoir lieu avant, après ou en même temps que la coloration dans un temps écoulé de 90 secondes ou moins.

column12: Computerized method, computer program product and system for simulating the behavior of a woven textile interwoven at thread level
column13: A computer implemented method for simulating the behavior of a woven fabric at yarn level including: retrieving the layout of warp yarns, weft yarns and yarn crossing nodes; describing each yarn crossing node by a 3D position coordinate (x) and two sliding coordinates, warp sliding coordinate (u) and weft sliding coordinate (v) representing the sliding of warp and weft yarns; measuring forces on each yarn crossing node based on a force model, the forces being measured on both the 3D position coordinate (x) and the sliding coordinates (u, v); and calculating the movement of each yarn crossing node using equations of motion derived using the Lagrange-Euler equations, and numerically integrated over time, wherein the equations of motion account for the mass density distributed uniformly along yarns, as well as the measured forces and boundary conditions.

column12: PROCESS FOR GENOTYPIFICATION AND SELECTION OF BOVINE CATTLE FOR THE PRODUCTION OF BETA-CASEINE A1 FREE COW MILK AND ITS USE IN THE PREPARATION OF FOOD FOR CHILDREN'S NUTRITION.
column13: The present disclosure is related to the biotechnological industry and the specialized food manufacturing industry. The advantage of the present invention with respect to the compositions of the state of the art, lies in its ability to genotype cattle according to the CSN2 gene to identify and select bulls and cows that bear the genotype CSN2 A2 / A2. To reproduce and raise dairy cattle that have the capacity to produce milk composed of BCAS A2 and that is free of BCAS A1. Cow's milk with the aforementioned characteristics can be used for manufacturing specialized products for infant feeding. The present method involves the insertion of a point mutation in the codon, where the bovine polymorphism of the BCAS A1 and the BCAS A2 occurs, using a modified oligonucleotide at its 5' end. The product of the CSR PCR, which results from the amplification of CSN2 A2, presenting a restriction site for a specific endonuclease, which does not occur with the product of the CSR PCR of CSN2 A1. After the amplification, the products of the CSR PCR are digested with the specific endonuclease and the restriction fragments are analyzed on a 1% of agarose gel. The genotype of the animals is defined according to the pattern of the fragment bands, which result from the restriction enzymatic digestion.

column12: Methods and apparatus for additive manufacturing utilizing multifunctional composite materials, and articles made therefrom
column13: A method of depositing a multiphase material. The method includes providing a Continuous Multifunctional Composite (CMC) phase containing at least one continuous element in a polymeric matrix, passing the CMC phase through a feeding system containing a cutting system, producing a predetermined length of the CMC phase, providing a flow a molten polymer such that the molten polymer and the CMC phase are merged into a continuous co-extrusion nozzle so as to produce a co-extruded multiphase material, and depositing the co-extruded multiphase material onto a surface. An apparatus for depositing a multiphase material. The apparatus contains a co-extrusion nozzle, a means to introduce a CMC phase and a molten polymer into the co-extrusion nozzle, such that the molten polymer and the CMC phase are co-extruded and deposited on a surface. An article containing a CMC phase containing continuous elements embedded in a polymer resin forming a multiphase structure.

column13: A filter cigarillo (1) comprises a bunch (2), which includes tobacco (4) surrounded by a binder (6). The second section (14) is connected to the natural-leaf wrapper (12) by an outer tipping (16).

column13: Device and process for the simultaneous filtration and recovery of heat from fluid streams, continuously, using a moving bed of small particles of magnetic material 3 acting as filtering element and intermediate conductor of the heat between a fluid stream, which is hot and dirty, which enters the device via the pipe 1 and exits, cold and clean, via the pipe 6, and another cold stream which enters via the pipe 13 and exits, hot, via the pipe 18, this device being characterized in that the mass flow rate of the moving bed can be regulated by means of magnetic valves for solids 7, 19, and in that its cleaning is achieved by means of fixed elements 9, pulsating magnetic fields produced by coils 11 and a dirt collector 12, recirculation of the bed being achieved by means of pulsating magnetic fields produced by the coils 24 or also by means of pneumatic or mechanical transportation.

column12: METHODS AND APPARATUS FOR ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING UTILIZING MULTIFUNCTIONAL COMPOSITE MATERIALS, AND ARTICLES MADE THEREFROM
column13: A method of depositing a multiphase material. The method includes providing a Continuous Multifunctional Composite (CMC) phase containing at least one continuous element in a polymeric matrix, passing the CMC phase through a feeding system containing a cutting system, producing a predetermined length of the CMC phase, providing a flow a molten polymer such that the molten polymer and the CMC phase are merged into a continuous co-extrusion nozzle so as to produce a co-extruded multiphase material, and depositing the co-extruded multiphase material onto a surface. An apparatus for depositing a multiphase material. The apparatus contains a co-extrusion nozzle, a means to introduce a CMC phase and a molten polymer into the co-extrusion nozzle, such that the molten polymer and the CMC phase are co-extruded and deposited on a surface. An article containing a CMC phase containing continuous elements embedded in a polymer resin forming a multiphase structure.

column12: A vaccine for foot-rot, procedure for the preparation thereof, and applications.
column13: A vaccine for foot-rot, procedure for the preparation thereof, and applications. The vaccine comprises one or more of the following strains of Dichelobacter nodosus NCTC 12909, NCTC 12910 and NCTC 12911, optionally together with Freund's incomplete adjuvant. The procedure involves mixing equal quantities of solutions in PBS-formaldehyde of one or more of the aforesaid strains of Dichelobacter nodosus, optionally incorporating the same quantity of Freund's incomplete adjuvant. Application in veterinary medicine for the prevention of foot-rot in sheep, goats, cattle and pigs.

column13: ESTA INVENCION SE REFIERE AL METODO DE OBTENCION DE UN BARNIZ A BASE DE RESINA FURFURAL-ACETONA Y ACEITES SECANTES MEDIANTE UN PROCESO DE CALENTAMIENTO DE LOS MATERIALES USADOS CON REDUCCION POSTERIOR CON SOLVENTES Y UTILIZANDO LOS SECANTES METALICOS QUE NOS PERMITAN OBTENER UN VEHICULO QUE FORMULADO CON LOS PIGMENTOS ANTICORROSIVOS Y LOS SOLVENTES CONVENCIONALES NOS PROPORCIONE UNA COMPOSICION ANTICORROSIVA ADECUADA, CONOCIENDO QUE LAS RESINAS FURANICAS TIENEN BUENAS PROPIEDADES PROTECTORAS, ASI COMO LA CAPACIDAD DE LOS ACEITES SECANTES DE FORMAR PELICULA Y SECAR AL AIRE EN SISTEMAS DE UN SOLO COMPONENTE, SIN NECESIDAD DE UTILIZAR CATALIZADORES ACIDOS PARA SU CURADO, SINO SOLAMENTE SECANTES METALICOS. PARA LA OBTENCION DEL BARNIZ DE INVENCION SE UTILIZA UNA PAILA PREVISTA DE UN AGITADOR, TERMOMETRO Y CUALQUIER TIPO DE CALENTAMIENTO. PARA LA OBTENCION DEL PRIMARIO ANTICORROSIVO SE UTILIZA CUALQUIER EQUIPO DE DISPERSION, UTILIZANDO COMUNMENTE EN LA INDUSTRIA DE PINTURA.\!

column12: Hardware for integral image computing (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: The present invention, as expressed in the statement of this specification, consists of mixed signal hardware for computing the integral image in the focal plane through a grouping of basic cells of sensing-processing whose interconnection can be reconfigured by peripheral circuitry that it makes possible a very efficient implementation of a very useful processing task in artificial vision, such as the calculation of the integral image in scenarios such as monitoring of natural spaces, robotics, assistance in unmanned aerial navigation, etc. The scientific-technical area of the invention is that of physical technologies, specifically microelectronics. Its framework of general application would be that of electronic systems with very low power consumption designed to carry out artificial vision tasks, that is, capture of images, analysis of them and action in case the results of such analysis so require. As specific applications of these devices could be proposed in turn numerous examples: monitoring of industrial processes, monitoring of natural spaces, automated surveillance of public places, robotics, help with unmanned aerial navigation, etc. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR FEEDING A PULVERIZED MATERIAL
column13: The present invention is referred to a method and an apparatus for feeding a pulverized material. The apparatus comprises fuel feeding means to supply pulverized fuel. Flexible means are coupled between the fuel feeding means and dosing means for the filling of the dosing means. The dosing means are closed and pressurized once that the dosing means have been filled. The pulverized material is discharged from the dosing means while controlling the pressurization during the discharge, in order to provide a continuous and constant discharge of the pulverized fuel. The apparatus includes means for detecting a minimum level or weight of pulverized fuel in the dosing means, and means for depressurizing the dosing means once that the minimum level of the pulverized fuel has been reached.

column12: LOCAL FACTORS ANALYSIS IN LOCALIZED VIRTUAL STORE FOR CONFIGURING A PRODUCTS PORTFOLIO
column13: A set of factors affecting a sold volume of the product is collected at a store in a geographical portion of a geographical area. A subset of a set of area stores is identified having a corresponding sold volume of the product. An intrinsic capacity of the product is computed by adjusting the sold volume of an area store by a first volume where the first volume is due to a sale of a second product at the area store. A modified intrinsic capacity is computed by modifying an effect of a factor from the subset on the intrinsic capacity such that the effect is worse than an effect of the factor at the store. A virtual store is constructed using modified intrinsic capacities of a sub-subset of area stores. A target volume of the product is set at the store as the virtual intrinsic capacity at the virtual store.

column12: Plenoptic ocular device
column13: The invention relates to a plenoptic ocular device (1) intended to be coupled in an ocular port of an optical instrument configured to generate a real image of a sample on a focal plane situated in a region close to the ocular port, the plenoptic ocular device being configured to capture the real image, generate a set of elemental images and send them to recording means with spatial discretisation (8) which in turn comprises communication means configured to transmit the set of elemental images to external image processing means. The plenoptic ocular device (1) comprises a tubular element (2), a coupling element (3), a diaphragm (4), a first lens arrangement (5), a second lens arrangement (6), a lens array (7) and a recording means with spatial discretisation (8).

column12: METHOD FOR MELTING GLASS
column13: The present invention is related to a method for melting glass using the combustion of pulverized fuel as a heating source for melting raw materials for producing glass. The method comprising the steps of, feeding a regulated controlled flow of a mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas under pressure for pneumatic transport in at least one distribution means; discharging the mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas from feeding means toward at least one of said distribution means; regulating in a controlled manner the pulverized fuel-air or gas mixture from the distribution means to each of a plurality of burners in a glass melting region of the glass melting furnace; supplying simultaneously a second fuel together with the pulverized fuel-air or gas mixture to each of said burners whereby a combustion cycle is carried out in the glass melting furnace; burning simultaneously said pulverized fuel-air or gas mixture and said second fuel by means of said burners in the glass melting region of said glass melting furnace while providing a combustion flame with high thermal efficiency to carry out a controlled heating for melting the glass; and, counteracting erosive and abrasive effects of the pulverized fuel in the glass melting furnace by means of refractory materials.

column12: METHOD FOR MELTING GLASS IN A RECUPERATIVE GLASS MELTING FURNACE
column13: The present invention is referred to a method for producing glass in a recuperative glass melting furnace. A controlled flow of a mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas under pressure is feed to a series of feeding means. The mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas is discharged from the feeding means toward at least one distribution means, wherein the pulverized fuel-air or gas mixture is regulated in a controlled manner from the distribution means to each of a plurality of burners in a glass melting region of the recuperative glass melting furnace. Combustion air is preheated through of at least a heat exchanger of the recuperative glass melting furnace, and the preheating combustion air and mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas is simultaneously mixed in the glass melting region of said glass melting furnace to provide a combustion flame with high thermal efficiency to carry out the melting of the glass.

column12: METODO PARA AUMENTAR LA RESISTENCIA DEL TOMATE Y OTRAS FRUTAS Y HORTALIZAS PERECEDERAS A SU MADURACION E INFECCION MEDIANTE LA APLICACION EXTERNA DE RESVERATROL.
column13: La presente invención se refiere a un método para aumentar la resistencia del tomate y otras frutas y hortalizas a su maduración e infección mediante la aplicación externa de Resveratrol, incluyendo los procedimientos de inmersión, lavado, fumigación, espolvoreo o cualquier otra forma de aplicación externa de resveratrol con el fin de conservarla después de su recogida. La presente invención se refiere a los tratamientos anteriormente citados con resveratrol puro, cualquiera de sus derivados o cualquier producto natural o manufacturado que contenga resveratrol y que puedan ser aplicados tanto antes como después de la cosecha.

column12: Multi-Layer Film and Articles Made Therefrom
column13: A polyethylene-based multi-layer film, which is particularly useful as a greenhouse film, is provided. The multi-layer film contains an ethylene/α-olefin interpolymer composition having a Comonomer Distribution Constant (CDC) in the range of from 75 to 200, a vinyl unsaturation of less than 0.15 vinyls per one thousand carbon atoms present in the backbone of the ethylene-based polymer composition; a zero shear viscosity ratio (ZSVR) in the range from 2 to 20; a density in the range of from 0.903 to 0.950 g/cm 3 , a melt index (I 2 ) in a range of from 0.1 to 5 g/10 minutes, a molecular weight distribution (M w /M n ) in the range of from 1.8 to 3.5.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR FEEDING A PULVERIZED MATERIAL.
column13: The present invention is referred to a method and an apparatus for feeding a pulverized material. The apparatus comprises fuel feeding means to supply pulverized fuel. Flexible means are coupled between the fuel feeding means and dosing means for the filling of the dosing means. The dosing means are closed and pressurized once that the dosing means have been filled. The pulverized material is discharged from the dosing means while controlling the pressurization during the discharge, in order to provide a continuous and constant discharge of the pulverized fuel. The apparatus includes means for detecting a minimum level or weight of pulverized fuel in the dosing means, and means for depressurizing the dosing means once that the minimum level of the pulverized fuel has been reached.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR FEEDING A PULVERIZED MATERIAL
column13: The present invention is referred to a method and an apparatus for feeding a pulverized material. The apparatus comprises fuel feeding means to supply pulverized fuel. Flexible means are coupled between the fuel feeding means and dosing means for the filling of the dosing means. The dosing means are closed and pressurized once that the dosing means have been filled. The pulverized material is discharged from the dosing means while controlling the pressurization during the discharge, in order to provide a continuous and constant discharge of the pulverized fuel. The apparatus includes means for detecting a minimum level or weight of pulverized fuel in the dosing means, and means for depressurizing the dosing means once that the minimum level of the pulverized fuel has been reached.

column12: METHOD FOR MELTING GLASS
column13: The present invention is related to a method for the combustion of pulverized fuel as a heating source for melting raw materials for producing glass. The method including the steps of, feeding a regulated controlled flow of a mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas under pressure for pneumatic transport in at least one distribution means; discharging the mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas from feeding means toward at least one of said distribution means; regulating in a controlled manner the pulverized fuel-air or gas mixture from the distribution means to each of a plurality of burners in a glass melting region of a glass melting furnace; burning the pulverized fuel by means of the burners in the glass melting region of said glass melting furnace while providing a combustion flame with high thermal efficiency to carry out a controlled heating for melting the glass; and, counteracting erosive and abrasive effects of the pulverized fuel in the glass melting furnace by means of refractory materials. The refractory materials being selected of silica-alumina-zircon, magnesite, chrome-magnesite, magnesia-alumina spinel, alumina-silicate, zircon-silicate, magnesium oxide silica or alumina mixtures of the same.

column12: METHOD FOR MELTING GLASS IN AN OXY-FUEL GLASS MELTING FURNACE
column13: The present invention is related to a method for melting glass in a glass melting furnace using oxygen and a pulverized fuel such as petroleum coke. A mixture of pulverized fuel and air is feeding under pressure from at least a feeding means. The mixture of pulverized fuel and air is discharged from the feeding means toward at least one distribution means. The mixture is regulated in a controlled manner from the distribution means to each of a plurality of burners in a glass melting region of the glass melting furnace. A flow of oxygen is supplied simultaneously together with the pulverized fuel-air mixture to each of said burners whereby a combustion cycle is carried out in the glass melting furnace. Finally, the pulverized fuel-air mixture and the flow of oxygen are burned simultaneously by means of said burners in the glass melting region of the glass melting furnace to provide a combustion flame with high thermal efficiency to carry out a controlled heating for melting the glass.

column12: PIXEL CELL HAVING A RESET DEVICE WITH ASYMMETRIC CONDUCTION
column13: Embodiments of the disclosure provide a solution to carry out High Dynamic Range (HDR) imaging based on dynamic well capacity adjustment without incurring additional spatial-temporal noise and consequent Signal-to-Noise Ratio (SNR) dips caused by the sub-threshold operation of a CMOS (Complementary Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor) reset transistor in a pixel cell. Embodiments of the disclosure employ realizations of transistors other than CMOS, e.g. Tunnel Field-Effect Transistors (TFETs), featuring asymmetric conduction between two of its terminals, where asymmetric conduction means that current can only flow in one direction between those two terminals. In some embodiments, one of such realizations plays the role of the pixel reset transistor in order to exploit the asymmetric conduction to perform dynamic well capacity adjustment. As a result, the sources of spatial-temporal noise arising from the sub-threshold operation of the pixel reset transistor in CMOS implementations are removed.

column12: METODO PARA AUMENTAR LA RESISTENCIA DE LA UVA A LA INFECCION Y MADURACION MEDIANTE LA APLICACION EXTERNA DE EXTRACTOS NATURALES OBTENIDOS A PARTIR DE LA VID.
column13: Método para aumentar la resistencia de la uva a la infección y maduración mediante la aplicación externa de extractos naturales obtenidos a partir de la vid. La presente invención se refiere a un procedimiento de aplicación de un extracto natural obtenido a partir de la vid para aumentar la resistencia de la uva a las infecciones fúngicas y a su maduración, incluyendo la fumigación y riego con el citado extracto sobre cultivos de uva en vid y parra, o directamente sobre la uva cosechada con el fin de conservar la uva durante el almacenamiento. La presente invención se refiere a los tratamientos anteriormente citados con cualquier extracto natural o manufacturado obtenido mediante extracción con etanol u otro disolvente adecuado a partir de la vid con el fin de mejorar la resistencia natural de la uva.

column12: Multi-layer film and articles made therefrom
column13: A polyethylene-based multi-layer film, which is particularly useful as a greenhouse film, is provided. The multi-layer film contains an ethylene/α-olefin interpolymer composition having a Comonomer Distribution Constant (CDC) in the range of from 75 to 200, a vinyl unsaturation of less than 0.15 vinyls per one thousand carbon atoms present in the backbone of the ethylene-based polymer composition; a zero shear viscosity ratio (ZSVR) in the range from 2 to 20; a density in the range of from 0.903 to 0.950 g/cm 3 , a melt index (I 2 ) in a range of from 0.1 to 5 g/10 minutes, a molecular weight distribution (M w /M n ) in the range of from 1.8 to 3.5.

column12: Dietary supplement based on ethyl ferulate
column13: Nutritional supplement, feed formulation and methods to improve the efficiency of meat production of a bovine animal, using ethyl ferulate as a nutritional supplement; where the administration of ethyl ferulate at bovine animal, is premixed with an excipient food grade, feed formulation, balanced food, concentrated food, and the like. The ethyl ferulate administration is daily during the final stage of fattening bovine animal, wherein the final stage of fattening is 20 to 40 last days.

column12: Beta-Hydroxy-Gamma-Aminophosphonates and Methods for the Preparation and Use Thereof
column13: The present invention provides β-hydroxy-γ-aminophosphonates, β-amino-γ-aminophosphonates, and analogs thereof that inhibit carnitine acyltransferases. The invention also provides compositions comprising these β-hydroxy-γ-aminophosphonates, β-amino-γ-aminophosphonates, and analogs, and methods of the use of such compounds and compositions in the treatment, amelioration or prevention of pathological conditions, diseases or disorders that are linked with fatty acid metabolism, such as non-insulin dependent diabetes or obesity. The invention also provides processes for the preparation of such compounds and compositions.

column12: Method and system for obtaining virtual geometries and detection of non-moldable areas in pieces (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)
column13: Method and system for obtaining virtual geometries and detection of non-moldable areas in pieces, based on the meshing of a geometry (q) of a piece (200) in a plurality of points (pij) and facets (fi) triangular; and in the classification of said points (pij) and facets (fi) following an analysis by planes according to a direction of demolding (vector vz). For this, the facets (fi) are grouped into subgroups (πk) with which closed polygons are defined (ck). Each point (pij) is then classified according to its projection on the closed polygons (ck); and each facet (fi) is classified according to the classification of the points (pij) it contains. Thus, an automated and efficient analysis of any arbitrary morphology of the piece (200) is achieved. (Machine-translation by Google Translate, not legally binding)

column12: METHOD FOR ENHANCING RESISTANCE OF GRAPES TO INFECTION AND MATURATION BY EXTERNAL APPLICATION OF NATURAL EXTRACTS FROM THE VINE
column13: The invention relates to a method for applying a natural extract from the vine with the aim of enhancing resistance of grapes to fungal infection and maturation, including the spraying of and irrigation with said extract on the vine and stalks in grape crops or directly on the harvested grapes with the purpose of preserving the grapes during storage. The invention also relates to the above-mentioned treatments using any natural or manufactured extract from the vine obtained by extraction with ethanol or another appropriate solvent with the purpose of enhancing natural resistance of the grapes.

column12: BETA-HYDROXY-GAMMA-AMINOPHOSPHONATES AND METHODS FOR THE PREPARATION AND USE THEREOF.
column13: The present invention provides Î²-hydroxy-Î³-aminophosphonates, Î²-amino-Î³- aminophosphonates, and analogs thereof that inhibit carnitine acyltransferases. The invention also provides compositions comprising these Î²-hydroxy-Î³-aminophosphonates, Î²-amino-Î³- aminophosphonates, and analogs, and methods of the use of such compounds and compositions in the treatment, amelioration or prevention of pathological conditions, diseases or disorders that are linked with fatty acid metabolism, such as non-insulin dependent diabetes or obesity. column12: DEVICE FOR ATTACHING A WEAR OR PROTECTION ELEMENT TO A SHOVEL OF A SOIL-SHIFTING MACHINE AND CORRESPONDING ATTACHMENT METHOD AND WEAR OR PROTECTION SYSTEM
column13: The invention relates to a device for attaching a wear or protection element (5) to a shovel of a soil-shifting machine, comprising: a base (7) with a housing (15) having a front wall (17) and a rear wall (19) with a through-opening (21); a stop (9), with a lower part (25) housed in the housing (15); a screw (11) that passes through the opening (21), the end of said screw being fixed to the stop (9); and partially compressed elastic means (13) arranged between the screw (11) and the opening (21). When the elastic means (13) are fully compressed, the length thereof is L0. In a mounted position, the stop (9) has a front face (27) facing the front wall (17) where the distance between the two is D1 and the distance between said head and said opening (21) has a value of D2, and in the mounted position, D2 - L0 > D1 is satisfied.

column12: Bir aşınma veya koruma elemanını bir toprak kaydırma makinesinenin bir küreğine bağlamaya yönelik cihaz ve ilgili bağlantı yöntemi ve aşınma veya koruma sistemi.
column13: Mevcut buluş, bir toprak kazı makinesinin bir kepçesi üzerine bir aşınma veya koruma elemanını (5) sabitlemeye yönelik bir sabitleme cihazı ile ilgili olup, şunları içermektedir: -bir geçiş deliğine (21) sahip bir ön duvara (17) ve bir arka duvara (19) sahip bir yuvaya (15) sahip bir altlık (7), - yuvada (15) barındırılan bir alt kısma (25) sahip, bir durdurucu (9), - deliğin (21) içinden geçen ve durdurucuya (9) sabitlenen bir uca sahip, bir vida (11), - vida (11) ve delik (21) arasında düzenlenen kısmen sıkıştırılmış elastik araçlar (13). Elastik araçların (13) tamamen sıkıştırılması durumunda, bu araçlar bir uzunluğa (L0) sahiptir. Monte edilmiş konumda, durdurucu (9), ön duvara (17) karşıt bir ön yüze (27) sahiptir, burada her ikisinin arasındaki mesafe D1'dir ve söz konusu baş ve söz konusu delik (21) arasındaki mesafe bir değere (D2) sahiptir ve monte edilmiş konumda koşul D2 - L0 > D1 karşılanmaktadır.

column12: METHOD FOR MELTING GLASS
column13: The present invention is related to a method for the combustion of pulverized fuel as a heating source for melting raw materials for producing glass. The method including the steps of, feeding a regulated controlled flow of a mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas under pressure for pneumatic transport in at least one distribution means; discharging the mixture of pulverized fuel and air or gas from feeding means toward at least one of said distribution means; regulating in a controlled manner the pulverized fuel-air or gas mixture from the distribution means to each of a plurality of burners in a glass melting region of a glass melting furnace; burning the pulverized fuel by means of the burners in the glass melting region of said glass melting furnace while providing a combustion flame with high thermal efficiency to carry out a controlled heating for melting the glass; and, counteracting erosive and abrasive effects of the pulverized fuel in the glass melting furnace by means of refractory materials. The refractory materials being selected of silica-alumina-zircon, magnesite, chrome-magnesite, magnesia-alumina spinel, alumina-silicate, zircon-silicate, magnesium oxide silica or alumina mixtures of the same.

column12: METHOD TO PURIFY FERULC ACID AND/OR SALTS THEREOF
column13: Methods to purify ferulic acid and/or salts thereof, both in solid state as in solution, the methods include: dissolve the ferulic acid, with a selective organic solvent, recover and isolate the solution from the insoluble impurities with filters; recover the organic solvent evaporating the solution; mix the concentrated extract of ferulic acid with water to pre-crystallize the hydrosoluble impurities; evaporate the mixture to remove the remains of the organic solvent; concentrate the mixture free of solvent in an evaporator; cool the mixture down to 40° C.; let the concentrated mixture set for 1 h, to then isolate by sedimentation the water-insoluble impurities; re-heat the mixture free of impurities to 70° C.; purify the mixture through a synthetic resin, transfer the purified mixture to a crystallizing container to crystallize the ferulic acid; remove the mother liquor of crystallization of the precipitate of ferulic acid; dry the ferulic acid.

column12: BARRIER FOR DEPOSITION OF PARTICLES
column13: The invention relates to a barrier for the deposition of particles, intended to protect thoroughfares by facilitating snow or sand to collect on the windward zone of the barrier against which the wind is blowing, or on the rear zone thereof, without reaching the thoroughfare. The invention comprises a plurality of screens combining a geogrid and wire netting which are secured to posts anchored to the ground.

column12: METHOD FOR EXTRACTING FERULIC ACID AND/OR ITS SALTS
column13: Method for extracting ferulic acid and/or its salts from a previously conditioned source rich in ferulic acid and its salts which comprises adsorbing the ferulic acid and/or its salts on a column packed with synthetic resin, desorbing the ferulic acid and/or its salts using an organic solvent, separating the liquor rich in ferulic acid into two fractions according to their water content, separately concentrating the two liquor fractions, mixing and concentrating said fractions, adding 2 volumes of water to them, concentrating the mixture obtained, separating out the insoluble impurities by sedimentation, pre-crystallizing the ferulic acid and/or its salts with a synthetic purification resin, crystallizing out the ferulic acid and/or its salts, separating the ferulic acid and/or its salts from the crystallization mother liquors and drying it and screening it.

column12: METHOD FOR EXTRACTING FERULIC ACID AND/OR SALTS OF SAME
column13: The invention relates to a method for extracting ferulic acid and/or salts of same, from a previously conditioned source rich in ferulic acid and salts of same, comprising: adsorbing the ferulic acid and/or the salts thereof in a column filled with synthetic resin; desorbing the ferulic acid and/or salts of same with an organic solvent; separating the liquor rich in ferulic acid into two fractions according to the water content thereof; concentrating the two fractions of liquor separately; mixing and concentrating said fractions; adding two volumes of water thereto; concentrating the mixture obtained; separating the insoluble impurities by sedimentation; pre-crystallising the ferulic acid and/or salts of same with a synthetic purification resin; crystallising the ferulic acid and/or the salts thereof; separating the ferulic acid and/or the salts thereof from the crystallisation mother liquor; and drying and sifting same.

column12: METHOD FOR CONDITIONING WASTEWATERS RESULTING FROM THE NIXTAMAL, MASA AND TORTILLA INDUSTRY.
column13: The novel method for conditioning wastewaters resulting from the nixtamal, masa and tortilla industry, known as nejayote (corn nixtamalization effluent), is intended to remove suspended solids in order to obtain a product ideal for different purposes, the method including the following steps: (a) conditioning nejayote: (b) conditioning the hydrolase enzyme; (c) incubating the resulting mixture; (d) adding a flocculant; (e) separating the flocculated material of the clarified nejayote, completely removing any suspended material. The clarified product, nejayote free of suspended solids, is useful as raw material for processes or technologies intended to recover compounds with commercial or strategic value such as: phenolic compounds, carbohydrates, salts or water for being reused or discharged in an environmentally safe manner.

Quando os meios elásticos (13) estão totalmente comprimidos, eles têm um comprimento L0. Em uma posição montada, o batente (9) tem uma face frontal (27) oposta à parede frontal (17), onde a distância entre ambos é D1 e a distância entre a citada cabeça e o citado furo (21) tem um valor D2, e sendo atendida a condição D2-L0>D1 na posição montada.

column12: WEAR OR PROTECTIVE ELEMENT TO THE EARTH-MOVING MACHINE BUCKET FASTENING DEVICE, CORRESPONDING FASTENING METHOD AND THE WEAR OR PROTECTIVE SYSTEM
column13: FIELD: machine building.SUBSTANCE: group of inventions relates to the earth-moving machine bucket wear or protective element fastening device. Wear or protective element to the earth-moving machine bucket fastening device includes base, including body with the front wall and rear wall, which has a passageway extending from the said body and defining the longitudinal axis, stopper, which lower part is adapted for location in the said body, screw having a first end with the head and a second end, and elastic means. In the installed position, the stopper lower part is located in the body, the screw passes through the passageway and by one first or second end is attached to the stopper so, that one other of such ends is located on the passage side opposite to the body. Elastic means is located between the screw head and the passageway, when the said second end is attached to the stopper, or the nut located at the said second end and a passageway, when the said first end is attached to the stopper and the elastic means is partially compressed. Stopper has a front surface opposite to the said front wall and a rear surface opposite to the said rear wall. Elastic means elastic force pushes the rear surface towards the rear wall.EFFECT: increase in the wear and protective elements service life.16 cl, 21 dwg

column12: METHOD FOR PURIFYING FERULIC ACID AND/OR SALTS THEREOF
column13: The invention relates to methods for purifying ferulic acid and/or salts thereof, in solid-state and in solution, the methods comprising: dissolving the ferulic acid, using a selective organic solvent; recovering and separating the solution from the insoluble impurities using filters; recovering the organic solvent by evaporating the solution; mixing the concentrated extract of ferulic acid with water to pre-crystallise the water-soluble impurities; evaporating the mixture to eliminate the remaining organic solvent; concentrating the mixture without solvent in an evaporator; cooling the mixture to 40° C; leaving the concentrated mixture to stand for one hour to separate the water-insoluble impurities by means of sedimentation; reheating the mixture without impurities to 70° C; purifying the mixture by means of a synthetic resin; transferring the purified mixture to a crystallising receptacle to crystallise the ferulic acid; stirring the crystallisation mother liquor of the ferulic acid precipitate; and drying the ferulic acid.

LOS MEDIOS ELÁSTICOS (13), TOTALMENTE COMPRIMIDOS, TIENEN UNA LONGITUD L0. EN UNA POSICIÓN MONTADA, EL TOPE (9) TIENE UNA CARA ANTERIOR (27) ENFRENTADA A LA PARED ANTERIOR (17) DONDE LA DISTANCIA AMBAS ES D1 Y LA DISTANCIA ENTRE DICHA CABEZA Y DICHO ORIFICIO (21) TIENE UN VALOR D2, Y SE CUMPLE QUE, EN LA POSICIÓN MONTADA, D2 – L0> D1.
